description: ServiceLevelObjective is the Schema for the ServiceLevelObjectives API.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: ServiceLevelObjectiveSpec defines the desired state of ServiceLevelObjective.

alerting.description: Alerting customizes the alerting rules generated by Pyrra.

disabled.description: Disabled is used to disable the generation of alerts. Recording rules are still generated.

name.description: Name is used as the name of the alert generated by Pyrra. Defaults to "ErrorBudgetBurn".

description.description: Description describes the ServiceLevelObjective in more detail and gives extra context for engineers that might not directly work on the service.

indicator.description: ServiceLevelIndicator is the underlying data source that indicates how the service is doing. This will be a Prometheus metric with specific selectors for your service.

bool_gauge.description: BoolGauge is the indicator that measures whether a boolean gauge is successful.

grouping.description: Total is the metric that returns how many requests there are in total.

latency.description: Latency is the indicator that measures a certain percentage to be faster than the expected latency.

grouping.description: Grouping allows an SLO to be defined for many SLI at once, like HTTP handlers for example.

success.description: Success is the metric that returns how many errors there are.

total.description: Total is the metric that returns how many requests there are in total.

latencyNative.description: LatencyNative is the indicator that measures a certain percentage to be faster than the expected latency. This uses the new native histograms in Prometheus.

grouping.description: Grouping allows an SLO to be defined for many SLI at once, like HTTP handlers for example.

latency.description: Latency the requests should be faster than.

total.description: Total is the metric that returns how many requests there are in total.

ratio.description: Ratio is the indicator that measures against errors / total events.

errors.description: Errors is the metric that returns how many errors there are.

grouping.description: Grouping allows an SLO to be defined for many SLI at once, like HTTP handlers for example.

total.description: Total is the metric that returns how many requests there are in total.

target.description: Target is a string that's casted to a float64 between 0 - 100. It represents the desired availability of the service in the given window. float64 are not supported: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/controller-tools/issues/245

window.description: Window within which the Target is supposed to be kept. Usually something like 1d, 7d or 28d.

status.description: ServiceLevelObjectiveStatus defines the observed state of ServiceLevelObjective.

type.description: Type is the generated resource type, like PrometheusRule or ConfigMap
